title: Senior Systems Administrator
description:
Job Description
Job Description
Description:


Starbird is a Bay Area born company and the nation's first super-premium fast-food concept. Starbird is blazing trails in the fast-food industry by challenging industry conventions and serving feel good crispy chicken. While on a relentless pursuit of deliciousness, Starbird creates food people can feel good about eating. All the food is fresh, scratch-made, created with trustworthy ingredients and served by passionate team members. Starbird makes accessing their five-star flavor easy with an omni-channel technology experience and seamless online and in-store ordering. Starbird's hospitality mission is to create a positive, memorable experience and connection with every single guest. Our service standards match our food, super-premium. We are growing rapidly, and we'll be adding additional locations in both the Bay Area and Southern California this year. To help fuel this growth, we are looking for amazing people who have the passion for the work we do here and to join our movement.


Our Culture
Our team members are the lifeblood of our organization. We select team members that exhibit our company values and have a positive attitude and disposition. We believe in promoting from within our organization and helping our employees to build their skills. To encourage self-growth within our organization, Starbird provides an educational enrichment program and a language learning program for all our employees. Whereas many companies give generously to worthy community-focused organizations, we focus our philanthropic efforts on the development and futures of all our beloved team members.


About you
At Starbird, the Senior Systems Administrator performs a variety of technical tasks in the area of computer systems and networks, under the general direction of the Director of Technology. Develops and maintains all systems, applications, security, and network configurations. Recommends upgrades, patches, and new applications and equipment. Provides technical support and guidance to users. This position has responsibility for the analysis of hardware and software in a distributed networking environment utilizing accepted network management and monitoring software and systems. This position deals with moderate to advanced levels of technical systems. Prepare program documentation and procedures. Perform other duties as assigned.


Key Job Responsibilities
โขProvide support to staff in their use of technology while adhering to our internal service level agreements (SLAs).
โขDevelop and maintain system training procedures, reinforcing company objectives, and standard operating procedures (SOPs).
โขStandardize software and processes to ensure compliance with SOPs and identify opportunities for improvement.
โขCollaborate independently and as part of a team to implement and configure systems to align with our tactical and strategic goals.
โขOffer solutions to address current inefficiencies and assist in the implementation of new processes for operations teams.


Skills & Knowledge
โขMinimum of 5+ years of relevant experience required; Bachelor's degree preferred.
โขAdvanced proficiency with Google Workspace applications, Zoom Phone, Dropbox, Slack, Mac, and Windows operating systems.
โขAdvanced proficiency with MDM solutions, security applications such as Crowdstrike, and disaster recovery solutions.
โขExperience with integrating and supporting third-party systems through API or similar.
โขKnowledge of hardware troubleshooting, networking configuration, security, and system troubleshooting.
โขStrong written and verbal communication skills, including the ability to train users, communicate across all organizational levels, and create technical documentation.
โขForward-thinking with a creative mindset, capable of identifying root causes and solving problems.
โขAbility to work both independently and collaboratively within a team.
โขAbility to ensure compliance with all local, state, and federal laws and regulations.
โขExperience with restaurant technologies such as POS, KDS, Online Ordering, etc.


Abilities & Working Conditions
โขPhysical capability to stand and move for up to 8 hours, and able to lift up to 25 lbs. regularly.
โขRequired skills include grasping, writing, standing, sitting, walking, repetitive motions, bending, climbing, listening, hearing, and visual acuity.
โขManual dexterity required for the installation and operation of restaurant equipment.
โขEffective communication skills, both written and verbal, with empathy and efficiency.
โขFlexibility to work nights and weekends, with variable schedules sometimes on short notice.
โขWillingness to travel to other company sites as needed.
โขStrong attention to detail, exceptional organizational skills, and the ability to excel in a dynamic business environment.
โขCapacity to prioritize and manage multiple projects, often with competing resources and timelines.




PM22

title: Senior Traction Power Engineer
description:
PGH Wong Engineering, Inc. has a proud and lengthy history of delivering innovative, challenging, and complex projects. From our origin as a two-person systems consulting firm in 1985 in San Francisco, California, PGH Wong is now a full-service engineering, architecture, construction management, and program/project management consulting firm for public and private entities across the nation. Together, we strive to exceed client expectations and deliver exceptional outcomes on signature projects around the nation. 

Responsibilities include but are not limited to the following:


Serve as the Traction Power Engineer in the conceptual, preliminary, and final design of complex and high-profile transit projects.
Directing, preparing, reviewing, and approving the preparation of engineering designs, drawings, and specifications for rail transit traction power projects.
Providing technical direction and assuring accuracy of the work produced by the design team, including plans, specifications, calculations, simulations, and estimates. 
Preparing and directing production of load flow studies.
Interfacing with other disciplines to assure proper coordination.
Assuring compliance of design with all applicable codes and regulations.
Interfacing with the Project Manager to determine schedules and monitor design progress.
Attending meetings with clients and third parties as required to coordinate various design activities. 
Preparing reports for systems studies.
Qualifications and Experience:


BSEE degree and a minimum of 10 years of related work experience is required. 
Experience in planning and design of rail transit systems, utility power systems, or major infrastructure projects is required.
California Professional Engineer's license or Engineer-in-Training certification is preferred.
Skills and Competencies:


Potential to lead engineering staff.
Excellent written and oral communications skills.
Knowledge of electrical power systems design involving power transformers, medium and high voltage substation equipment, and electrical distribution systems is required. In addition, knowledge of communications, rail transit systems, and central control facilities is desirable. 
Familiarity with rail transit industry standards, practices, and regulations is required.
Proficiency in MS Office (Excel, Word, and PowerPoint).
Ability to work in a cooperative team environment, with a significant client interface.

title: Dasher
description:
Your time. Your Goals.
What is DoorDash
Available in over 4,000 cities in the U.S, DoorDash connects local businesses and local drivers (called Dashers) with opportunities to earn, work, and live.
As a Dasher, you can be your own boss and enjoy the flexibility of choosing when, where, and how much you earn. All you need is a mode of transportation (bike, car, scooter) and a smartphone to start making money. Itโs that simple. You can even sign up and begin working that same day. Why deliver with DoorDash
Choose your own hours: When and where you work is totally up to you.
Freedom to dash anywhere: Deliver near your home or in a city you're just visiting.

title: Sales Manager
description:
COMPANY OVERVIEW:

Rumble Boxing is bringing full-body, boxing-inspired group fitness to your block. At Rumble, we believe the hour we spend working out can inspire the other 23 hours of our day. We believe in sharing our good vibes and energy with the world, and that, in many ways, it's our most substantial offering. And more than anything, we believe in each other. Our mission is to create a new generation of boxers with style, sophistication, and sweat.

POSITION:

The purpose of the Sales Manager is to oversee Studio sales, bring in new memberships, and assist with studio operations, marketing, and grassroots efforts. Bringing new members to the studio and booking them into classes. 

The Sales Manager assists the General Manager and studio owners in meeting and exceeding studio revenue goals and new membership sales targets by executing strategic community outreach, in-club lead generation, and generating member referrals. 

Under the management of a Franchise Owner and with the support of a Rumble Support Team, the Sales Manager must exemplify leadership qualities in all areas of the business. 

The Sales Manager must have the ability to build lasting relationships with prospective and current members in order to build a strong ambassadorship and retain members. The Sales Manager is rooted in sales, marketing, and operations while upholding our mission to fuel energetic communal experience. 

This position will be based in San Ramon, CA. 

REQUIREMENTS:

2+ years of fitness sales or relevant sales experience preferred
Confident in generating personal sales and supervising Sales Reps
Ability to manage and drive multiple revenue streams, including memberships and retail
Previous management or supervisory experience preferred
Must have excellent communication and strong interpersonal skills in person, over the phone, and by email. 
Must be solution-based and results-oriented, competitive spirit
Ability to recognize areas of improvement and make changes using good judgment
An affinity and passion for fitness
Solid writing and grammar skills
Highly organized, proficient in data management, ability to prioritize and meet deadlines
Professional, punctual, reliable, and organized
Strong attention to detail and accuracy
Trustworthy and able to handle confidential information
Ability to work harmoniously with co-workers, clients, and the general public
Proficiency with computers and ability to learn and use Studio software system
College Degree Preferred
Authorization to work in the United States required
* This is a part-time position. The candidate must be able to work a flexible schedule with nights and weekends availability.

RESPONSIBILITIES:

Align with the studio owner's daily, weekly, and monthly revenue targets
Lead generation, including Grass Roots Marketing and networking
Implement a sales process to schedule prospects into introductory classes
Execute sales process of lead generation, follow up, and close
Book quality appointments to achieve monthly sales quota
Membership and retail sales
Help manage staff schedule
Supervise Sales Associates
Assist all instructors at the studio
Independently make decisions related to high-level customer service
Maintain cleanliness and organization of the studio
Enforce studio policies and procedures
Schedule and participate in networking/community events and studio promotions
Strategically manage marketing campaigns to generate leads for the studio
Any other duties as assigned
COMPENSATION & PERKS:

This position offers a very competitive base rate, plus an opportunity to earn commission and bonus if all goals are met
Complimentary Fitness Membership while employed
Employee Retail Discounts
Unlimited Growth Potential within the company
We are an equal opportunity employer and prohibit discrimination/harassment without regard to race, color, religion, age, sex, national origin, disability status, genetics, protected veteran status, sexual orientation, gender identity or expression, or any other characteristic protected by federal, state or local laws.

company: i9 Sports - Central San Mateo County, CA
title: Senior Sport Coordinator Basketball
description:
Job Description
Job Description
Benefits/Perks

A team-based atmosphere with a focus on Fun!
Opportunity to build coaching skills and be a role model for athletes
Online training opportunities
Company Overview
Founded in Tampa, Florida, i9 Sports is the nations first and largest youth sports league franchise business in the United States with over 1 million registrations in more than 500 communities from New York to Hawaii. Established in 2003 by Frank Fiume on the principle that the number one reason kids play organized sports is to have fun, not to become the next draft pick.
i9 Sports offers youth sports leagues, camps, and clinics for kids ages 3-17 in todays most popular sports such as flag football, soccer, basketball, volleyball, and baseball. With our focus on fun, safety, convenience, and good sportsmanship, i9 Sports is reinventing the youth sports experience for families across the country. Its the way youth sports should be. What does your company do?

Job Summary
The Sports Coordinator is responsible for enhancing the i9 Sports Experience for players and coaches. The Sports Coordinator will need to build relationships with players, parents, and coaches while making sure that the instructional aspects of the i9 Sports Experience are delivered. Observing, assessing, and assisting our coaches is paramount. The position entails hands-on involvement with practices and games among all age groups and skill levels.

Responsibilities

Consistently demonstrate a positive attitude and superior customer service skills

Hands-on involvement with practices and officiate games among all age groups and skill levels
Empower volunteer coaches to lead practice sessions focusing on fundamentals, skill development and fun

Responsible for enhancing the i9 Sports Experience for players, coaches, and parents

Communicate game day information to players and parents
Understand & enforce the i9 Sports rules books ensuring fun, learning, and safety for all players
Keep time and score during games; manage an age-appropriate level of instruction and competition
Supervise the overall operation of designated sport on game day
Qualifications

Excellent communication skills
Sport-specific coaching and/or officiating experience & knowledge
Highly motivated self-starter; can work independently & solve problems
Awareness & ability to take charge of any situation to ensure the safety of players
Positive attitude and a strong ability to build professional relationships

title: Network Administrator
description:
Company Description

For More Open Positions Visit us at:
http://recruiting.woongjininc.com/

***NO C2C***

Our Mission

WOONGJIN, Inc. is a rapidly growing team who provides a range of unique, exceptional, and enhanced services to our clients. We have a strong moral code that includes the service of goodness without expectations of reward. We are motivated by the sense of responsibility and servant leadership.

Job Description

The HW and Network Administrator is responsible for all server and infrastructure installations, maintenance troubleshooting and remediation for data center. This person will be focused on improving the stability and performance of the system, maintaining and improving the security posture of the systems, continuous monitoring of system health, and troubleshooting issues that arise. Internal title for this role is System Engineering.

- Datacenter On-site Support

- Analyze, research, configure, install networks & computer systems

- Works with OEM on server repair warranty and parts replenishment

- Escorts visitors within datacenter

- Interface with electrical and infrastructure vendors for routine maintenance visits

- Order supplies to replenish data center stock or for upcoming projects

- Uses advanced troubleshooting skills for hardware and infrastructure problem or failure remediation

- Generates and works from ticket system to provide support and project

- Operating Windows / Linux / Storage

- Visual Inspection, On-site network Cable wiring

Salary range: 85K~ 96K

Qualifications

- 3+ years' experience of datacenter network operation, data center and infrastructure engineer in medium to large data center environments (100-500 servers with supporting infrastructure servers)

- 3+ years' experience of Server / Storage Hardware Management (DELL / HP / IBM / Oracle)

- Experience with cabling system (UTP, Optical Fiber)

- 3+ years hands on experience with server repair and warranty parts service

- Experience with protocols and services based on TCP/IP

- Experience with routers & switches

- Experience working in a Highly Available datacenter environment with high uptime with little to no disruption in services or availability

- Ability to work well within a Team

- Bachelor Degree in Computer Science or related field preferred

PHYSICAL DEMANDS AND WORKING CONDITIONS

Physical requirements include occasional lifting/carrying of 50 pounds; visual acuity, speech and hearing; hand and eye coordination and manual dexterity necessary to operate a computer keyboard and basic office equipment.
Subject to sitting, standing, reaching, walking, twisting, and kneeling to perform the essential functions. Working conditions are primarily inside an office environment with travel to various locations on an occasional basis.
Additional Information

All your information will be kept confidential according to EEO guidelines.

 *** NO C2C ***

title: Cook Supervisor
description:
Job Description
Job Description



The Cook Supervisor is responsible for all kitchen or cooking operation in the absence of the Executive Chef or Sous Chef. Will perform any cooking, baking, butchering required and performs any and all duties in the kitchen. This is an on-call union position, and all individuals in this role are represented by UNITE HERE! Local 19.

POSITION RESPONSIBILITIES:
Perform all duties of kitchen including cook, bake, and butcher hot and cold food. Direct, train and supervise culinary employees to ensure various styles of food are produced according to work orders and production sheets.
Ensure all work orders are completed according to schedule using the posted contracts prep list as a guideline and by delegating workload to culinary staff effectively.
Maintain the cleanliness of all work areas (including but not limited to refrigerators, counters, tables, storage areas) in accordance to Board of Health, ECO-and OSHA regulations
Ensure food quality by rotating and storing products appropriately and production of food is consistent.
Determine, order, and inform management of merchandise orders. 
Inform management/supervisor of any merchandise shortages or equipment malfunctions.
Perform other related duties as required.

POSITION REQUIREMENTS:
Able to speak, read and write in the English language effectively.
Must have two (2) years of experience in a commercial kitchen in a lead or management role.
Scheduling flexibility is essential, willing to work evenings, nights, weekends and holidays
Have a valid California Food Handler certification.
Must be able to work in a high stress environment.
Ability to work in confined spaces for long periods of time.
Able to work in an environment having both hot and cold temperature extremes.
Attend mandatory meetings and complete other duties assigned by supervisor.
Perform general cleaning tasks to adhere to ECO Sure, health and safety standards.
Comply with company & departmental procedures, expectations, goals and standards.
Consistently providing friendly and pleasant customer service by being courteous, professional, and maintaining a positive attitude.
Lifting/Carrying: Ability to lift/carry items using proper lifting/carrying procedures up to 50 lbs.
Ability to move heavy (200+ pound) wheeled carts.


Salary: $30.08/hr
Team San Jose is an equal opportunity employer.

title: Crew Leader
description:
Job Description
Job Description


Are you a team player who is always down to get the job done? Fancy yourself a leader? Like to keep moving, lift heavy furnishings and put things into place in an ever changing environment that is beautiful and creative? This could be the perfect position for you!

Our boutique home staging + interior design firm based in San Francisco is looking for a Crew Leader who can help load furniture onto trucks, drive to stagings, unload trucks, do basic furniture touch ups, hang art, and manage a small moving crew with daily operations in the field.

Duties include: 
Plan the week, load/unload furniture, drive box trucks. hang art, work with design staff on furniture placement, small repairs, organize furniture in the field and the warehouse, wrap and protect furnishings, art and accent during transitions. Manage a small team of movers. Be the engine that motivates swift and efficient completion of jobs.

Requirements:

Working knowledge of the Bay Area

Ability to lift over 75 lbs

Prior experience working in a Moving or Warehouse 

Team player - reliable, trustworthy, focused, organized, attention to detail 

Can-do attitude and happy to follow and provide verbal + written directions

Current driverโs license/clean record + experience driving a Van or Box truck

Available to work Monday-Friday 8:00am- 5pm (+/- due to seasonality) with some overtime
Bonus Points for:

Professional experience in moving or staging company

Knowledge in furniture repair

Ability to hang art

Benefits:

Friendly, collaborative, hardworking, creative environment

Competitive Hourly rate 

Paid holidays, medical benefits, 401k, + profit sharing (if qualified)

How Do I Apply?
Please fill out job application online at https://www.studiodhome.com/studiodhome-2/job-openings/ and email jobs@studioDhome.com with subject: Crew Leader + your full name


This opportunity is contingent on clean background check + drug test

title: Maintenance Supervisor
description:
Job Description
Job Description

The Maintenance Supervisor will drive the business objectives by supervising and developing a unionized team of 10 Maintenance Department personnel, giving work direction and ensuring they are working safely and efficiently.
 
The Maintenance Supervisor is at all times responsible for the quality of work, responsiveness, and safety of their crew to ensure the Company goals and objectives are met; daily, monthly, annual.  The Maintenance Supervisor is responsible to supervise a crew of maintenance employees, team building, setting expectations and holding the team accountable for the quality, safety, efficiencies and sanitation of their assigned area.
The Maintenance Supervisor will supervise maintenance activities in all areas of the facility - This includes overseeing breakdown repairs, preventive and predictive maintenance and root cause analysis.
This position will report to the Maintenance Manager.
This position, by ensuring compliance with company policies and procedures, is responsible for recommending, developing, implementing and managing safety, quality and food safety on all product lines.
*NOTE: Our factory runs 24/7 with three shifts. The Maintenance Supervisor position scheduled primarily for first shift, with some possibility of occational night/weekend shifts.
Specific Knowledge & Skills
Knowledge of State and Federal Safety Requirements.
Strong written and oral communications skills*
Strong knowledge of reactive, preventive and predictive maintenance processes
Ability to manage multiple priorities/projects
Ability to set priorities, be self-disciplined and consistent*
Ability to lead and develop direct reports*
Ability to identify training needs and to define training programs for Maintenance employees*
Ability to work effectively in a union environment*
Ability to work and function effectively in a union environment
Good knowledge of food processing and packaging machinery preferred
Strong computer literacy in MS Office and CMMS*
Experience with high speed wrapping machines is preferred
May be required to have a valid California driverโs license and driving record must meet GCC standards
Working Conditions
Must be able to work seated or standing for at least 8 hours
Must be able to lift a minimum of 35 lbs
Occasional travel is required
Must be able to concentrate for extended periods of time paying close attention to detail
Regular office environment 50%
In support of the maintenance team, working in the field is required 50%
Conditions in the field include:
Ability to climb stairs and ladders; must be able to work from heights
Exposure to vibration, moving mechanical parts and loud noise
Capable of using protective equipment such as hard hats, safety glasses/goggles, safety shoes, hearing protection, air masks, respirators, etc. in the performance of job duties
Ability to work in extreme temperatures and will be exposed to heat, cold, wind, rain, dust, confined spaces, elevated areas, dirt, ash particles and fuel particles
Must be able to work outdoors in varying weather conditions
Must be able to kneel, bend, crouch and climb as required
Scope of Responsibilities
Ensures all systems, such as packaging / processing equipment, moulding lines, water chillers, glycol systems, plant hot water systems, boilers and heat trace systems and facilities, are operational, running efficiently, and maintained to reduce downtime.
Partners with the Safety Manager, and ensures a safety culture where no one gets hurt and that all accidents can be prevented.
Reviews production schedules and estimates craftsman labor requirements and procedures for completion of job assignments. This will require a direct communication with Production, Engineering, and/or Quality Assurance.
Evaluates situations, schedules work assignments and leads craftsmen in maintaining and repairing the manufacturing equipment, ensuring minimal downtime & efficiency.
Inspects completed work for conformance to blueprints, specifications, and OEM standards.
Communicates with oncoming and off-going shifts at pass down meetings, ensuring a smooth work transition.
Uses Root Cause Analysis to resolve problems, and/or assists craftsmen in resolving problems to prevent reoccurrences.
Ensures proper training and upgrades skills of craftsmen on new equipment and/or procedures.
Supports the Maintenance Planner in completing work orders and PMโs as needed.
Understands and works within the Union contract.
Maintain the Kronos time records and manage attendance issues providing timely coaching
Ensures all policies and waivers are followed, including Day-of-Rest and Meal Waiver
Oversees the parts inventory; critical spare parts, min/max of spare parts, bin locations and ordering with the Maintenance Manager.
Ensures project work, PM completion and Work Order completion in full and on time.
Schedules and conducts inspections and audits as required.
Partner with any outside vendors or contractors as necessary.
Evaluates, works with maintenance peers, and gets alignment around improving effectiveness of maintenance processes.
Holds our employees accountable for the quality of their work and their relationship with their customers; coach and provide performance feedback to employees as necessary.
Maintains existing 5S, Master Sanitation, Food Safety processes around maintenance work.
Ensure maintenance processes are followed and properly documented.
Orders parts when necessary.
Assesses, identifies and implements training needs of staff, team leads, and participate in development of training programs when required.
Ensure that training matrix is updated as needed.
Partners with Human Resources Business Partner to ensure labor issues are addressed in a timely manner and within the guidelines of the collective bargaining agreement. (may involve participation in grievance meetings, contract negotiations, mediations or arbitrations as needed).
Set expectations and priorities and holds employees accountable.
Manage/resolve employee issues, disputes and/or grievances; elevate as necessary.
Maintains a good balance between service levels and maintenance costs.
Looks for cost improvements when possible.
Recruits, trains, coaches, recognizes and lets go (when necessary) the crew members.
Education and Work Experience
BA Degree or 4 to 8 years of related experience and/or training; or equivalent combination of education and experience
Experience in a food manufacturing environment, preferred
Salary Range: $78,000 - $110,000/yr

description:

title: SEO Analyst/Strategist
description:
Job Description
Job Description

Job Title: SEO Analyst/Strategist 
Company: Nuvolum
Location: 435 Pacific Ave. San Francisco, CA. 94133
Job Type: Full-time
Job Description:
Nuvolum, a leading digital marketing agency, is seeking a talented and experienced SEO Analyst/Strategist to join our dynamic team. As an SEO Analyst/Strategist at Nuvolum, you will play a crucial role in driving organic traffic and improving the online visibility of our clients' websites. You will work closely with our clients and internal teams to develop and implement effective SEO strategies that align with our clients' business goals.
Responsibilities:
Develop and execute comprehensive SEO strategies to increase organic search visibility and drive qualified traffic to clients' websites.
Conduct thorough keyword research to identify valuable opportunities and optimize website content accordingly.
Perform on-page optimization, including meta tags, headers, URL structure, and internal linking, to improve website rankings.
Implement technical SEO enhancements, such as XML sitemaps, robots.txt, canonical tags, and structured data markup, to improve website crawlability and indexability.
Analyze website performance using SEO tools and analytics platforms to identify areas for improvement and track key metrics.
Conduct competitive analysis to identify strengths, weaknesses, and opportunities for clients' SEO efforts.
Stay up-to-date with industry trends, search engine algorithm updates, and best practices in SEO to ensure optimal performance and compliance.
Collaborate with content creators, web developers, account managers, production and other teams to implement SEO recommendations effectively.
Monitor and report on SEO performance, providing regular insights and recommendations to clients and internal stakeholders.
Stay informed about the latest developments in digital marketing and propose innovative ideas to enhance Nuvolum's SEO services.
Requirements:
Proven work experience as an SEO Analyst/Strategist or similar role.
In-depth knowledge of search engine algorithms, ranking factors, and SEO best practices.
Strong understanding of keyword research, on-page optimization, technical SEO, and off-page SEO techniques.
Proficiency in using SEO tools, such as Google Analytics, Google Search Console, SEMrush, Moz, or similar platforms.
Familiarity with content management systems (CMS) and website development processes.
Analytical mindset with the ability to interpret data and generate actionable insights.
Excellent communication skills, both written and verbal, with the ability to explain complex SEO concepts to clients and internal teams.
Strong organizational and project management skills, with the ability to prioritize tasks and meet deadlines.
Continuous learning mindset and a passion for staying up-to-date with the latest SEO trends and strategies.
Bachelor or masterโs degree in marketing, communications, computer science, or a related field (preferred).
Join Nuvolum's vibrant team of digital marketing professionals and contribute to the success of our clients' online presence. If you are an SEO expert with a passion for driving results and are eager to work in a fast-paced, collaborative environment, we would love to hear from you!
To apply, please submit your resume, portfolio (if applicable), and a cover letter highlighting your relevant experience and achievements in SEO

title: IT Service Desk Analyst
description:
About the Position
 
The Golden State Warriors are looking for an IT Service Desk Analyst to serve as the front line of our IT organization, triaging all incoming requests for GSW and Chase Center staff. In this role, you will work on a range of IT services, including device support (laptops, monitors, printers, and peripherals), network connectivity, email, calendar, communication & collaboration application support, identity & access management, and telephony. To be successful, you will need to be proficient supporting Windows 10 and Mac OS X platforms in an enterprise environment and have a solid grasp of network fundamentals.
 
In addition, this role will augment the Event Support team, working closely with Arena Operations staff to discover, fulfill and support IT requirements with the NBA, concert promoters, vendors and other Chase Center clients. This position reports to the Manager, IT Service Desk.
 
This is an excellent opportunity to share your expertise while learning more about this growing sports and entertainment organization that values your initiative and dedication!
 
 This is a full-time position based in San Francisco, CA (with occasional visits to Oakland and Santa Cruz, CA). 
 
Key Responsibilities
  
Answer and respond to all Service Desk calls, emails, IT Support Slack channels, and walk-up requests 
Track and monitor incidents, requests, and problems to ensure timely resolution 
Diagnose and resolve Tier 1 hardware, software, application, network, and telecommunication issues while operating in compliance with GSW policies and federal and state regulations 
Triage and classify incidents and requests within service level agreements 
Attend and possibly lead daily stand-up meetings with peers and other IT departments 
Order, Image, configure, deploy, and manage assets per departmental process 
Create, update, maintain documentation for clients and staff; provide technical guidance and training 
Provide game day setup, removal, troubleshooting and maintenance for NBA equipment for all Warriors basketball home games including preseason, regular season, and playoffs 
Provide event day set up and support for all other events at Chase Center 
Provide technical support and equipment setup for radio and TV broadcast connectivity, NBA scorer's table and media sections 
Maintain the integrity, security, and privacy of various systems by following GSW's policies and procedures. 
Other duties as assigned.  
Required Experience & Skills
  
Bachelor's degree or equivalent work experience 
Minimum 2 years of general IT troubleshooting and support experience 
Solid grasp of computer network connectivity, hardware, MAC and Windows operating systems, Active Directory and Microsoft applications in an enterprise environment 
Ability to understand and apply best practices while staying current with emerging technologies 
Experience resolving issues related to teleconferencing software (Zoom, Ring Central) and its respective hardware and also with Email, communication & collaboration tools (Office365, Slack, and Dropbox) 
Bit Locker device encryption & single sign-on services and multi-factor authentication tools RingCentral and voicemail services 
CompTia A+/Net+, ITIL Foundations, and other relevant certifications preferred 
Excellent written and verbal communication 
Strong service orientation with the ability to build positive relationships with clients and peers at all levels within the organization 
Ability to balance multiple projects at once in a fast-paced work environment  
Time Commitment
  
Ability to maintain a flexible schedule including early mornings, evenings, late nights, weekends, holidays, extended hours, and on call hours  
Physical Demands
  
Ability to sit or stand for long periods 
Ability to lift up to 50 lbs. 
Ability to carry equipment of various sizes (computer monitors, laptops, boxes, etc.) for long distances and up/downstairs  
Compensation
  
$39.00 - 41.00 per hour + Bonus 
Comprehensive Medical, Dental and Vision benefits for employees and dependents 
Employer 401K match 
Vacation, Summer Half-Day Fridays and a generous paid time off plan for pregnancy and parental leaves 
Warriors home tickets, team store discount and more! 
Pursuant to the San Francisco Fair Chance Ordinance, we will consider for employment qualified applicants with arrest and conviction records.
 
 Golden State Warriors is an equal opportunity employer.
 
We will ensure that qualified applicants with disabilities are provided reasonable accommodation to participate in the job application or interview process, to perform essential job functions, and to receive other benefits and privileges of employment.
 
Want to learn more about who we are and what we value? Visit www.warriors.com/employment

description:

title: Client Services Manager
description:
Assisting Hands Home Care Fremont, a leader for In-Home Care services is looking for a Client Services Manager to join our team. At Assisting Hands, we are a people first company and you truly are the heart of our company. Not only do we provide a supportive work environment, but we also offer flexible scheduling, competitive pay, and benefits!

Role Description

We are seeking a full-time Client Services Manager for Assisting Hands Home Care Fremont located in Fremont, California. The Client Services Manager is responsible for maintaining relationships with new and existing clients and community partners in the healthcare industry. They will also perform client intakes, assessments, and regularly scheduled visits/wellness check-in calls. This individual is expected to act as an extension of our company's customer service department to ensure that the client's needs are met as per our company's standards.

The Client Services Manager will possess excellent communication skills, organization, and superior customer service. They will perform community outreach activities to strengthen Assisting Hands' relationships with healthcare organizations, connected networks, and social service centers. At the same time, they'll help in the development of marketing materials and strategic plans for outreach. The Client Services Manager role ensures that our clients and their families are satisfied and have a good overall experience with our services and act as the primary point of contact for all clients.

The Client Services Manager will also be proficient and have prior experience in hiring, scheduling and be able to supervise or provide coverage as needed. 

Annual Pay: $49,000-110,000 per year with bonus incentives

Location: In-person role at 39675 Cedar Blvd, Suite 180, Newark, CA 94560 (not a work from home position).

Compensation and Benefits of the Client Services Manager:

Competitive base salary + incentives

Health, Vision and Dental

401k plan

PTO and sick days

Car allowance

Supportive, fun, team environment and more!

Responsibilities

Generating regular streams of new business by building relationships with facilities/communities and representing the organization at networking events.
Conducting client intakes, assessments, and regularly scheduled visits/wellness check-in calls.
Developing and maintaining the client care plan, creating extraordinary client experiences and communicating with clients, families, care partners and referral sources.
Serving as a mentor to caregivers and supporting their care delivery.
Providing after-hours support for our clients, referral partners and prospective clients - this support may include email, telephone, scheduling and/or home visits.
Help out with hiring, scheduling tasks as needed.
What will it take to be an excellent Client Services Manager?

Your passion for elder care and helping clients in need of home care
Prior client management, sales and or marketing experience, preferably in the home care industry
Thrive in an independent, self-motivated environment
Great at building and maintaining relationships
A calm, positive demeanor at all times and is able to effectively multitask in a high functioning office environment.
Excellent written and oral communication skills
Superb follow up skills
Be team oriented and comfortable collaborating with other staff
Professionalism and the ability to grow our business
Responsible and accountable
Qualifications

A bachelor's degree in business, marketing, communications, or a related field preferred;
Previous experience in Home Care or Home Health preferred;
Minimum of 5 years of experience in healthcare administration, hospitality, customer service or sales experience;
Excellent communication, interpersonal, and problem-solving skills;
Demonstrated ability to build rapport with clients, families, and healthcare professionals;
An understanding of HIPAA regulations and compliance;
Ability to document conversations, organize reports, and conduct presentations;
Ability to prioritize and manage multiple tasks and meet deadlines;
Proficient in computer software programs - Google suite, Scheduling Software, CRM, MS Office (Word, Excel, PowerPoint);
Up-to-date car insurance, vehicle registration, and valid Driver's License;
Successful clearance of CDSS background checks with relevant work-related references.
 Compensation: $49,000.00 - $110,000.00 per year 

Assisting Hands Home Care Fremont prides itself on offering compassionate, dependable home care to their clients. We serve clients in Fremont, and surrounding areas. Our unparalleled reputation of quality home care covers a broad spectrum of services ranging from aging care for the elderly, post-surgery care, transitional care from a hospital or rehab, to post maternity care for those mothers who need care after the birth of their child.

Aside from the our mission for quality home care and passion for the value of family, one of the other reasons that Assisting Hands has provided such exceptional care to their clients is due to their high standards for hiring.

We believe that the caregivers are the face of the company. Our agencies hire caregivers that first and foremost align with our company's core values. We look for the three most important qualities in our caregivers which is professionalism, empathy, and strong communication skills. Additionally, our agency does a comprehensive background screening, training and verification of skill competency. 

We treat our caregivers with very high standards, and this translates to high quality care which makes a great difference to all elderly clients and their families.

Here are some testimonials from Assisting Hands caregivers: 

Some of the other comments made by various Assisting Hands caregivers are "I applaud this company for the high standards and ethics that I have witnessed..." - Julie J.

"I have worked for home care companies in the past and none of them are at all like Assisting Hands Home Care. I feel like a genuinely valued employee." Kelsey L.

"What I have experienced since working at Assisting Hands is that the company truly cares about its clients just as well as its employees. They are always willing to help and go the extra mile to meet everyone's needs." LaEasha G.

Assisting Hands Home Care and their employees believe that there is value to offering dependable care and compassion to those in need which is witnessed on a daily basis by both the staff and the clients. No matter what service is being provided, from light housekeeping and making meals to helping with bathing and grooming needs, caring for others with dignity and dedication is paramount to Assisting Hands Home Care which is reflected in AHHC caregivers.

title: Child Development Instructional Aide Program
description:
Who We Are

The San Francisco Unified School District (SFUSD) is the seventh largest school district in California, serving more than 55,000 students who speak more than 44 documented languages across 136 schools in the city of San Francisco every year. We aim for every student who attends SFUSD schools to discover his or her spark, along with a strong sense of self and purpose, and that all students graduate from high school ready for college and career, and equipped with the skills, capacities and dispositions outlined in SFUSD's Graduate Profile . Every day in our quest to achieve this mission we provide each and every student the quality instruction and equitable support required to thrive in the 21 st century.

What It Means to Work Here

When you join our team at SFUSD you can expect to be part of an inclusive, innovative, and equity-focused organization that approaches public education as a social justice movement, requiring broad collaboration across an array of strategic partners. In 2014, SFUSD created an inspiring statement, Vision 2025 , which captures our aspirations and vision for the future of public education in San Francisco. Alongside the District's strategic plan , Transform Learning. Transform Lives. , SFUSD is reimagining how public education will change over the next decade to meet the dynamic future of San Francisco. As a CORE district, SFUSD is also a leader in critical systems change for more comprehensive school accountability and innovations that help strengthen the instructional core, which is the foundation of our strategic plan and Vision 2025.

Who We Want

We want talented people from diverse backgrounds and experiences, who are inspired by our mission, steeped in equity, and who are motivated to unleash our children's potential. We want people who are strong collaborators, skilled communicators, and problem solvers who are comfortable in a community of continuous learning. 
 
Under supervision of a teacher/administrator, assists in the direct delivery of instruction in a children's center setting. The primary objective of such assistance is to affect learning for mastery by implementing both developmental and remedial methods in basic skill areas and content areas. The employee assists certificated staff by: implementing lesson plans (activities which include reviewing and correcting the work of pupils), participating in parent conferences, proctoring examinations, keeping relevant records, operating instructional equipment in appropriate instructional settings, as well as performing related duties as required.
 
Some positions may require conversational and written skills in a specific language(s) other than English related to the needs of the assignment. An ability to translate and adapt materials to and from English into that language(s) may also be required. Some positions may require that the employee furnish a certificate of clearance from the Department of Motor Vehicles in order to meet District insurability. 
 
Utilizes knowledge appropriate to satisfy the Distinguishing Characteristics of the class listed above, examples of which may include familiarity with teaching methods, instructional media, test scoring, school organization, and school rules and regulations. Demonstrates competency in performing the following tasks; working with pupils, acting quickly and effectively in emergencies, working with and relating to all individuals within the culturally diverse environment of SFUSD, and developing and maintaining effective, courteous communications with pupils, staff and public.

Minimum Qualifications

 
A high school diploma or its equivalent 
Six Units of Early Childhood Education 
Pass a medical examination 
Desired Qualifications

What We Offer

SFUSD offers a competitive salary of commensurate with experience in a similar position. We offer a comprehensive benefits plan including dental and vision plans, a defined benefit pension plan, disability, life insurance, flexible spending account options and vacation time. We also offer an inclusive and equity-centered environment where we encourage staff to bring their whole selves to work.

How to Apply

 
 Visit http://careers.sfusd.edu/ and create a new administrator account to begin your application.  
 You will be prompted to electronically attach a letter of interest, resume, references, and administrative credentials/licenses.  
 Our Human Resources team will then review your entire application to determine your eligibility status and contact you directly should you move forward in the process   
 For more information about SFUSD's mission and Strategic Plan please visit www.sfusd.edu . For other questions, contact us at paraeducators@sfusd.edu .

Non-Discrimination Policy

San Francisco Unified School District programs, activities, and practices shall be free from unlawful discrimination, harassment, intimidation, and bullying based on actual or perceived race, color, ancestry, national origin, ethnic group identification, age, religion, marital or parental status, physical or mental disability, sex, sexual orientation, gender, gender identity, or gender expression; or on the basis of a person's association with a person or group with one or more of these actual or perceived characteristics. This policy extends to the San Francisco County Office of Education, including community school programs and activities. For more information about the District's non-discrimination policy, please review Board Policy 4030.

title: Internal Organizer
Home Care Aide
description:
Job Description
Job Description



Supporting Independence, Enhancing Lives
SF-East Bay Area


Qualicare Home Care is hiring experienced Home Care Aides in East Bay Area! We are looking to build your career, by applying you will be trained at the most advanced home care agency in the industry.


We offer:



$19-22 hourly pay rate
Flexible hours/schedules with full time, part time, daytime, evening and weekend shifts
Paid training and orientation
Paid elective training courses available
Mileage reimbursement
Nurse mentorship
Benefits
Bonus Referral program
Career advancement opportunities
Paid time off
Pandemic precautions applied for your safety-PPE Provided
Open door policy come to us with your questions and concernWe are looking for the best but we provide the best as well, with one of the most competitive paying home care agency in the Bay Area with hourly salary range from $19 -$22. Come join the Qualicare family and let us help build your future in healthcare.


ESSENTIAL JOB FUNCTIONS/RESPONSIBILITIES:


Job Duties/Responsibilities:



Assistance with personal care and hygiene
Meal Preparation
Light Housekeeping
Accompany clients on outings
Shopping and errands
Medication Reminders
Ambulation and transporting of clients
Provide companionship to clients
Ability to follow care-plan
Documentation/Charting

QUALIFICATION REQUIREMENTS:



Must have HCA (Registered with Home Care Aide)
If CNA/HHA then must have proof of certification
Minimum of one (1) year of documented experience required
Negative TB skin test or chest x-ray
Covid- 19 Fully Vaccinated
Access to mobile phone
Ability to travel within the East Bay

title: Multipurpose Subject Teacher, 3rd Grade
description:
Requisition ID :  17961 
 
 Business Unit :  School Site 
 
 Job Code :  0700 
 
 FTE:  1.00 
 
 Credential :  Multiple Subject ,  English Learner Authorization ,  
 
 Grade :  3rd 
 
 Language :  , 

 Starts 8/10/2023. 

Who We Are

The San Francisco Unified School District (SFUSD) is the seventh largest school district in California, serving more than 57,000 students who speak more than 44 documented languages across 132 schools in the city of San Francisco every year. We aim for every student who attends SFUSD schools to discover his or her spark, along with a strong sense of self and purpose. Our goal is that all students graduate from high school ready for college and career, equipped with the skills, capacities and dispositions outlined in SFUSD's Graduate Profile . Every day in our quest to achieve this mission we provide each and every student the quality instruction and equitable support required to thrive in the 21st century.

What It Means to Work Here

When you join our team at SFUSD you can expect to be part of an inclusive, innovative and equity-focused organization that approaches public education as a social justice movement, requiring broad collaboration across an array of strategic partners. In 2014, SFUSD created an inspiring statement, Vision 2025 , which captures our aspirations and vision for the future of public education in San Francisco. Alongside the District's strategic plan , Transform Learning. Transform Lives. SFUSD is reimagining how public education will change over the next decade to meet the dynamic future of San Francisco. As a CORE district , SFUSD is also a leader in critical systems change for more comprehensive school accountability and innovations that help strengthen the instructional core, which is the foundation of our strategic plan and Vision 2025.

Who We Want

We want talented people with diverse backgrounds and experiences, who are inspired by our mission steeped in equity, and who are motivated to unleash our children's potential. We want people who are strong collaborators, skilled communicators, and problem solvers comfortable in a community of continuous learning.
 
We have high need for teachers in the following areas: 
  
Bilingual (Cantonese, Mandarin, Spanish) 
Special Education (Mild/Moderate, Moderate/Severe, Deaf & Hard of Hearing, Early Childhood Special Education) 
Physical Education  
Math 
Science 
Minimum Qualifications

SFUSD requires all teachers to hold or be pursuing a valid California teaching credential and an English Learner or Bilingual Authorization. We welcome applications from teachers who have not yet received their credentials, and our Credentials Team is happy to work with each teacher who's accepted a position in SFUSD to apply for permits that allow them to teach while pursuing a credential.

Desired Qualifications

What We Offer

SFUSD is committed to attracting and retaining the best educators in the nation. Benefits of teaching in San Francisco include:
  
Competitive salaries determined by experience, education level, and credentials 
Comprehensive medical, vision, and dental insurance for teachers and their eligible dependents 
City and state programs for housing assistance: 
Teacher Next Door Program: https://sfmohcd.org/teacher-next-door  
 MyHome Assistance Program: https://www.calhfa.ca.gov/homebuyer/programs/myhome.htm  
Additional salary stipend of $5000 for National Board Certified teachers 
Additional salary stipend of $2000 for credentialed teachers teaching in high potential schools and a $1000 stipend for teachers teaching hard to fill subject areas 
How to Apply

 
Go to: https://careers.sfusd.edu/  
Create an account and complete an application. 
Go to the "Current Openings" tab to view and apply for specific openings.  
Please check back often to connect your application to specific openings as they are posted. Applicants will be contacted based on the needs of the district. For more information about careers at SFUSD, please visit https://careers.sfusd.edu/ . For more information about SFUSD's mission and Strategic Plan please visit www.sfusd.edu . For other questions, contact us at teach@sfusd.edu .

Non-Discrimination Policy

San Francisco Unified School District programs, activities, and practices shall be free from unlawful discrimination, harassment, intimidation, and bullying based on actual or perceived race, color, ancestry, national origin, ethnic group identification, age, religion, marital or parental status, physical or mental disability, sex, sexual orientation, gender, gender identity, or gender expression; or on the basis of a person's association with a person or group with one or more of these actual or perceived characteristics. This policy extends to San Francisco County Office of Education, including community school programs and activities. For more information about the District's non-discrimination policy, please review Board Policy 4030.

description:
Job Description
Job Description

Benefits/Perks
Flexible Scheduling
Competitive Compensation
Career Advancement Opportunities
 
Job Summary
We are seeking an experienced Server to join our team! The Server is the face of our restaurant and plays an integral role in our customerโs dining experience. You will build rapport with customers, answer questions about the menu, take orders, and serve food and drinks. The ideal candidate is friendly, outgoing, and has fantastic attention to detail. 



Responsibilities: 
Take food and beverage orders from customers
Answer questions about the menu and preparation

title: Field Service Technician
description:
Job Description
Job Description
We are looking for a Field Service Tech to be in charge of all electrical and mechanical components of our large-scale parking installations. You will oversee deliveries and installations, perform troubleshooting and maintenance. Prior knowledge of mechanical parking structures is not required, but past experience should provide a foundation for success.

You must be comfortable working with a variety of subcontractors on construction sites. Communication and real-time problem solving are essential. Friendly demeanor with all customers is essential to this position. 

We are currently hiring in Menlo Park and this role will be preliminary onsite with some on call work.

Responsibilities:

Understand all elements of semi and fully-automated parking systems
Troubleshoot, repair, install parking system components
Implement tests to ensure all components are working correctly
Educating clients on how to use and maintain parking system
Perform maintenance and provide customer support
Diagnose problems and come up with solutions to repair them
Order parts needed for repairs if needed
Fill out detailed reports and keep records on services that have been performed
Explain issues with equipment and repairs to customers
Build and maintain relationships with customers
Other duties as assigned
Qualifications

1+ years experience servicing electro-mechanical equipment
Ability to read blueprints and diagrams (i.e. Construction Design Documents and Specifications, wiring diagrams is a must).
Ability to work flexible hours and work around a changing schedule (may require on call)
Excellent communication, interpersonal and diagnostic skills
Working knowledge of the equipment needed for the job (multimeter, hand tools, power tools).
Ability to work independently without much supervision and manage time effectively
Must be able to meet the physical requirements of the job which include bending, lifting heavy equipment, standing for extended periods of time and working in confined spaces.
Valid driver's license and reliable transportationParkworks is a full-service EPC company that offers world class semi-automated and fully-automated parking solutions to clients interested in increasing parking capacity and reducing vehicle emissions. Our installations require minimal maintenance and cost less than normal parking garages. Founded in 2015, certified WBE, we are experiencing unprecedented, rapid growth. Parkworks is the future of parking.

As an equal opportunity employer, Parkworks welcomes and embraces a diverse workforce. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity or expression, national origin, disability, genetic information, or protected military or veteran status.
Send resume to rrich@parkworksus.com

title: Crew Member
description:
Crew Member (24000793)

Description

**CULTIVATE A BETTER WORLD**

Food served fast does not have to be a typical fast-food experience.   Chipotle has always done things differently, both in and out of our restaurants. We are changing the face of fast food, starting conversations, and directly supporting efforts to shift the future of farming and food. We hope you will join us as we continue to learn, evolve, and shape what comes next on our mission to make better food accessible to everyone.

**THE OPPORTUNITY**

At Chipotle, we've created a better place to eat and work. Many employees start just expecting a paycheck but end up with a rewarding career. We provide exceptional training and a clear career path - over 80% of our managers were promoted from Crew. We prepare real food by hand every day in our restaurants. No freezers, microwaves or can openers to be found. We welcome experienced restaurant professionals and novices alike. We'll provide the training you need to feel confident working at any station - grill, cashier, prep, salsa and expo. We take pride in our exceptional customer service and it's up to each of our team members to create the friendly atmosphere that our customers expect and enjoy. So, whether you have experience as a dishwasher, cashier, server, host, bartender, cook, prep cook, FOH/BOH or no experience at all, we're always looking for passionate and enthusiastic people to join our team. At Chipotle, you'll join a team that's committed to Cultivating A Better World. If this sounds like something you'd like to be a part of, we'd love to meet you! See more details below and apply today.

**WHAT'S IN IT FOR YOU**

+ Tuition assistance (100% coverage for select degrees or up to $5,250/year)

+ Free food (yes, really FREE)

+ Medical, dental, and vision insurance

+ Paid time off

+ Holiday closures

+ Competitive compensation

+ Full and part-time opportunities

+ Opportunities for advancement (80% of managers started as Crew)

**WHAT YOU'LL BRING TO THE TABLE**

+ A friendly, enthusiastic attitude

+ Passion for helping and serving others (both customers and team members)

+ Desire to learn how to cook (a lot)

+ Be at least 16 years old

+ Ability to communicate in the primary language(s) of the work location

**WHO WE ARE**

Chipotle Mexican Grill, Inc. (NYSE: CMG) is cultivating a better world by serving responsibly sourced, classically cooked, real food with wholesome ingredients without artificial colors, flavors or preservatives. Chipotle has restaurants in the United States, Canada, the United Kingdom, France and Germany and is the only restaurant company of its size that owns and operates all its restaurants in North America and Europe. With employees passionate about providing a great guest experience, Chipotle is a longtime leader and innovator in the food industry. Chipotle is committed to making its food more accessible to everyone while continuing to be a brand with a demonstrated purpose as it leads the way in digital, technology and sustainable business practices. For more information or to place an order online, visit

**PAY TRANSPARENCY**

Pay range is $16.50 to $17.50, depending on skill level, experience and/or education. Compensation offered is also subject to local wage and hour laws.

Chipotle Mexican Grill is an equal opportunity employer that values diversity at all levels. As a people-first company rooted in values, our purpose extends beyond serving nutritious food using real ingredients. It means hiring world-class individuals and fostering a culture that champions diversity, ensures equity, and celebrates inclusion. All qualified applicants, regardless of personal characteristics, are encouraged to apply.

Qualified applicants with disabilities may be entitled to reasonable accommodation under the terms of the Americans with Disabilities Act and/or certain state or local laws. Please contact if you need an accommodation due to a disability to complete an application, job interview, and/or to otherwise participate in the hiring process.  **This email does not respond to non-accommodations related requests.**

title: Delivery Driver
description:
Your time. Your Goals.
What is DoorDash
Available in over 4,000 cities in the U.S, DoorDash connects local businesses and local drivers (called Dashers) with opportunities to earn, work, and live.
As a Dasher, you can be your own boss and enjoy the flexibility of choosing when, where, and how much you earn. All you need is a mode of transportation (bike, car, scooter) and a smartphone to start making money. Itโs that simple. You can even sign up and begin working that same day. With Dasher Direct, you can also get paid the same day!
Why deliver with DoorDash
Choose your own hours: When and where you work is totally up to you.
Freedom to dash anywhere: Deliver near your home or in a city you're just visiting.
Easy to get started: Don't worry about car inspections or vehicle restrictions. Just sign up and receive everything you need to start earning.
Receive deliveries right away: Once approved, log on to the Dasher app to receive nearby orders immediately.
Know how much you'll make: Clear and concise pay model lets you know the minimum amount you will make before accepting any order
Donโt wait for pay: Get paid the same day you dash, automatically and with no deposit fee - ever.
Earn extra money for your goals: Achieve your short-term goals or long-term dreams by driving or biking with DoorDash.
Sign Up Details
Requirements
18 or older
Any car, scooter, or bicycle (in select cities)
Driver's license number
Social security number (only in the US)
Final Step: consent to a background check
How to sign up
Click โApply Nowโ and complete the sign up
Get the app and go

title: Principal Software Engineer
description:
What You'll Do

Develop and implement application on generative large language models such as GPT4, Claude, Llama and their derivatives, ensuring they meet business requirements. - Customize and fine-tune LLMs for application specific tasks. - Optimize generative AI applications for performance, scalability, and reliability. Red-teaming to validate application robustness and precision. - Collaborate with cross-functional teams to integrate AI capabilities into existing and new product offerings. - Stay abreast of developments in AI and machine learning fields and suggest implementations of new technologies. - Design and develop APIs for AI model interaction. - Build clear documentation for developed models and systems for internal and external use. - Fix and resolve issues arising from AI applications.

Who You'll Work With

You will be part of the FSO engineering team, building AI/ML solutions. Engineers and define the "how" part of the solution. - Tdhe platform, security, release engineering, and support teams to deliver the product. - You run what you build, you will support the SRE/PRE teams in ensuring the smooth running of the product.

Who You Are 

- You are passionate about technical leadership. - You value mentorship and foster technical collaboration across teams and engineers. - You have a deep understanding of the observability needs of the industry and can use AI for breakthrough customer experiences. - You learn continuously and love to adopt tools and technologies that fit the problem you are trying to solve. - You value building solid relationships with your colleagues and are passionate about coaching and mentoring engineers.

Minimum Requirements

* Bachelor's degree in Computer Science, Engineering, or related field; Master's preferred

* 3+ years' experience in AI/ML development, focusing on generative models.

* 3 years' experience in Prompt engineering and prompting frameworks like: ReAct

* Chain-of-thought, and tree-of-thought. Understanding of tools like LangChain, Guidance and vector databases like pinecone.

Preferred Requirements

* Experience managing and evaluating neural network training using frameworks like Lightning and Hydra on GPU clusters

* Strong programming skills in Python and experience with machine learning frameworks like TensorFlow or PyTorch

* Hands-on experience with tools and libraries such as pandas, numpy, spacy, nltk, and scikit

* Familiarity with cloud platforms (AWS, GCP, Azure) and MLOps principles

* Experience with software development standard processes and agile methodologie

* Strong problem-solving skills and the ability to work in fast-paced environments

* xcellent verbal and written communication skills.

Why Cisco? #WeAreCisco. We are all unique, but collectively we bring our talents to work as a team, to develop innovative technology and power a more inclusive, digital future for everyone. How do we do it? Well, for starters - with people like you! Nearly every internet connection around the world touches Cisco. We're the Internet's optimists. Our technology makes sure the data traveling at light speed across connections does so securely, yet it's not what we make but what we make happen which marks us out. We're helping those who work in the health service to connect with patients and each other; schools, colleges, and universities to teach in even the most challenging of times. We're helping businesses of all shapes and sizes to connect with their employees and customers in new ways, providing people with access to the digital skills they need and connecting the most remote parts of the world - whether through 5G, or otherwise. We tackle whatever challenges come our way. We have each other's backs, we recognize our accomplishments, and we grow together. We celebrate and support one another - from big and small things in life to big career moments. And giving back is in our DNA (we get 10 days off each year to do just that). We know that powering an inclusive future starts with us. Because without diversity and a dedication to equality, there is no moving forward. Our 30 Inclusive Communities, that bring people together around commonalities or passions, are leading the way. Together we're committed to learning, listening, caring for our communities, whilst supporting the most vulnerable with a collective effort to make this world a better place either with technology, or through our actions. So, you have colorful hair? Don't care. Tattoos? Show off your ink. Like polka dots? That's cool. Pop culture geek? Many of us are. Passion for technology and world changing? Be you, with us! #WeAreCisco #appd_jobs So, you have colorful hair? Don't care. Tattoos? Show off your ink. Like polka dots? That's cool. Pop culture geek? Many of us are. Passion for technology and world changing? Be you, with us! #WeAreCisco #appd_jobs

Cisco is an Affirmative Action and Equal Opportunity Employer and all qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, gender, sexual orientation, national origin, genetic information, age, disability, veteran status, or any other legally protected basis.

Cisco will consider for employment, on a case by case basis, qualified applicants with arrest and conviction records.

title: Associate Account Manager
description:
Job Description
Job Description

imgix is the leading platform for real-time image management, optimization, and delivery services. Our cutting-edge technology helps businesses deliver high-quality visual experiences to their customers across various platforms and devices, anywhere in the world.
We are on the lookout for an enthusiastic Associate Account Manager who is adept at not only maintaining and growing existing client relationships but also skilled in spotting and leveraging upselling opportunities and ensuring on-time renewals. The right candidate will have a sharp ability to intuitively understand and predict client needs, proactively suggesting solutions that align with their objectives and challenges. This role demands a tactical approach to building relationships, aiming to create substantial and lasting connections with clients beyond just transactional interactions. An Associate Account Manager should be proficient in identifying areas for account growth and confidently navigate clients through our range of products to improve their overall experience and satisfaction. The key to thriving in this role lies in a forward-thinking attitude, a profound grasp of client requirements, and a dedication to effectively addressing their concerns, thereby building enduring trust and loyalty.
Responsibilities: 

Oversee a portfolio of existing accounts in the SMB cohort with a focus on achieving Net Revenue Retention (NRR) targets. 

Manage all post-sales operations including building and maintaining customer relationships. 

Collaborate closely with sales engineers, support teams, and the finance department. 

Conduct comprehensive account reviews, advising customers on their current usage of imgix, potential improvements, and future product expansions. 

Responsible for retaining and upselling customer contracts for assigned accounts. 

Act as the primary point of contact for customers, ensuring imgix meets their business needs. 

Advocate for customers within imgix, coordinating with internal teams on customer issues and needs. 

Track account and opportunity progress using our CRM system (SFDC). 

Occasional travel for client meetings, expected to be less than 10% of the time.
Requirements:

1-2 years of experience in a Sales role, ideally as a successful BDR, Associate Account Manager, Customer Success Manager, or Sales Support Engineer. 

Familiarity with SaaS and B2B business environments. 

Proficiency in using CRM systems, particularly Salesforce, and Google Workspace tools including Docs, Sheets, and Slides.

Experience/comfortable selling a technical solution to a technical audience. 

Strong verbal and written communication skills, with some exposure to presenting to technical teams and decision-makers in enterprise-level organizations. 

While not mandatory, previous experience or knowledge in the areas of images, Content Delivery Networks (CDNs), Digital Asset Management (DAMs), and website performance is highly beneficial. 

Basic understanding of or experience with Codepen and HTML is a plus. 

Willingness to engage in occasional travel for client meetings, conferences, and related events.

The targeted base pay range for this position is $65,000 to $85,000. In addition to base pay, the on-target earnings also consist of a significant bonus component, providing additional potential for earnings beyond the base salary. Our pay ranges reflect the minimum and maximum target for new hire pay for the full-time position determined by role, level, and location. Individual pay is based on additional factors including job-related skills, experience, and relevant education and/or training. The targeted pay range listed reflects the base pay only and does not include bonus, equity, or benefits.
imgix currently operates as a mostly remote workplace with employees distributed around the world. This role can be remote, with the option of being based in our San Francisco office as frequently as desired. Employee benefits are comprehensive (401(k), medical, dental, and vision), perks are generous, vacation time is flexible, parental leave is available and highly encouraged, and salaries are in line with industry averages. 
For the health and safety of all of our employees, imgix requires COVID-19 vaccinations for any employee who wishes to work out of the San Francisco office or attend in-person company events.
 this is a remote position

title: Driver
description:
Summary

Job title: Driver

Job ID: 202401860001

Department: Antioch - CED

Location: CA-Antioch

Description

Summary:

 Delivery drivers make local-area deliveries and pick-ups to/from customers and suppliers.  Drivers complete job duties by preparing, loading, unloading, operating and cleaning a truck; maintaining records; and helping to develop sales. 

Reports to: Warehouse Manager

Minimum Qualifications:

+  Ability to inspect, maintain, and operate a motor vehicle. 

+  Ability to load and unload a delivery truck from ground level or platform in a variety of warehouse and construction worksite situations. 

+  Ability to read and do math to correctly access warehouse materials for order picking, properly deliver orders, and correctly complete all paperwork for deliveries and pick-ups. 

Preferred Qualifications:

N/A

Working Conditions:
